      • update

        public static int update(java.lang.Object obj)
        Update a row in the table equal to the object type. The obj's type must exist as a table in the database - there has to be a perfect match between the Class Name and the Tabel Name (not case sensitive).
        Parameters:
        obj - will be updated in the table with the name equal with it's class name
        Returns:
        0 if the delete was succesful, otherwise -1

        public static int insert(java.lang.Object obj)
        Insert a row in the table equal to the object type. The obj's type must exist as a table in the database - there has to be a perfect match between the Class Name and the Tabel Name (not case sensitive).
        Parameters:
        obj - will be introduced in the table with the name equal with it's class name
        Returns:
        0 if the delete was succesful, otherwise -1

      • deleteAll

        public static int deleteAll(java.lang.Object obj)
        Deletes all the data the table equal to the object type. The obj's type must exist as a table in the database - there has to be a perfect match between the Class Name and the Tabel Name (not case sensitive).
        Parameters:
        obj - is used to select the table form which the data will be deleted
        Returns:
        0 if the delete was succesful, otherwise -1

      • deleteById

        public static int deleteById(java.lang.Object obj,
                             int id)
        Deletes one row from the table equal to the object type, which has the given id. The obj's type must exist as a table in the database - there has to be a perfect match between the Class Name and the Tabel Name (not case sensitive).
        Parameters:
        obj - is used to select the table form which the data will be deleted
        id - the value used to find the line which is going to be deleted from the table
        Returns:
        0 if the delete was succesful, otherwise -1

      • findById

        public static java.lang.Object findById(java.lang.Object obj,
                                        int id)
        Finds one row from the table equal to the object type, which has the given id. The obj's type must exist as a table in the database - there has to be a perfect match between the Class Name and the Tabel Name (not case sensitive). Returns null if the line with the given doesn't exists.
        Parameters:
        obj - is used to select the table where the line will be searched
        id - the value used to find the line
        Returns:
        the object with the given id

      • findAll

        public static java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Object> findAll(java.lang.Object obj)
        Return the list of objects generated with a ResultSet. The obj's type must exist as a table in the database - there has to be a perfect match between the Class Name and the Tabel Name (not case sensitive). The obj argument will be the type of the objects in the list.
        Parameters:
        obj - is used to select the table form which the data will selected. It also give the type of the elements in the LinkedList
        Returns:
        a LinkedList of objects retrieved from the database
